intro: Amblyopappus mendocinus, commonly known as the Mendocino amblyopappus, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces bristly, feathery seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
